summary: SummaryMAC Powder Kiss Lipstick is a weightless, moisture-matte lipstick that delivers a blur of soft-focus color. This groundbreaking formula contains moisture-coated powder pigments that condition and hydrate lips. Delivers the zero-shine look of matte, with a cushiony, light feel of a balm.
details: DetailsBenefitsImmediate and all-day hydrationComfortable formulaBlurs lines and smooths lipsLightweight buildable lipstickWeightless, soft matte lipstickFeaturesDelivering a blur of soft-focus colour, this weightless moisture-matte lipstick was developed to replicate a backstage technique: blending out edges of matte lipstick for a hazy effectResearch Results97% said it was comfortable throughout wear*97% said it left lips feeling soft and smooth*94% said it left lips feeling moisturized*97% said it felt weightless on lips**Consumer testing on 104 women after one weekItem 2535376How To UsePrep lips with Prep + Prime Lip Primer before applying colour. Apply Lipstick directly to lips. Reapply throughout the day as needed.IngredientsDimethicone, Tridecyl Trimellitate, Polyethylene, Phenyl Trimethicone, Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Hdi/Trimethylol Hexyllactone Crosspolymer, Zeolite, Kaolin, Alumina, Silica, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Polysilicone-11, Caprylyl Glycol, Polyhydroxystearic Acid, Flavor (Aroma), Sodium Saccharin, Tocopherol. May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77499), Bismuth Oxychloride (CI 77163), Blue 1 Lake (CI 42090), Carmine (CI 75470), Orange 5 Lake (CI 45370), Red 6 (CI 15850), Red 21 (CI 45380), Red 28 (CI 45410), Red 30 (CI 73360), Red 6 Lake (CI 15850), Red 7 Lake (CI 15850), Red 22 Lake (CI 45380), Red 28 Lake (CI 45410), Red 30 Lake (CI 73360), Red 33 Lake (CI 17200), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Yellow 6 Lake (CI 15985).Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up-to-date list of ingredients.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Prep lips with Prep + Prime Lip Primer before applying colour. Apply Lipstick directly to lips. Reapply throughout the day as needed.

reviews.headline: The neutral I didn't know I needed!
reviews.comments: OK, full transparency - I wanted to see if I could pull off Taylor Swift's coral lip from the podcast. The Ulta makeup artist suggested Mull It Over to me based on my inspiration, and I love it! No, it's not coral, BUT it is a gorgeous light terra cota that works for my skin color. It's now my go-to for daily wear. Love!

reviews.headline: Not worth a dime
reviews.comments: The test lipstick was applied before I got my hair done and the color was very nice.  By the time my hair was finished which was about 1.5 hours, the color was virtually gone.  The actual lipstick I purchased was returned.

reviews.headline: Nice lipstick!
reviews.comments: So shiny and beautiful color . I like it!

reviews.headline: Poor service and poor product
reviews.comments: I am a very unhappy customer.  This was my first purchase at the St. Cloud Minnesota Ulta and I will never be back.  I asked for their most long lasting lipstick, and this overpriced item is what they sold me.  When it didn't even last 2 hours, they refused to take back the unopened product, or even offer a store credit, it was clear that this is a company that does not prioritize its customers.

reviews.headline: Useless
reviews.comments: This is junk.  It wore off within an hour.  If all you want is one photo, fine, but if you use lipstick to leave the house, this is garbage.

reviews.headline: Waste of resources.  This stuff doesn't last.
reviews.comments: This was my first purchase at my local Ulta after asking for their longest lasting lip color.  By the time I got home the sample was no longer visible on my lips.  It didn't hold for 8 hours.  It didn't even stay for 2 hours.  When I went to return the unused lipstick, Ulta refused to take the return.  This was a total rip off, and I will never buy from Ulta again.  Poor product, overpriced, and ridiculous non-return policy.

reviews.headline: I love Mac Lipsticks!
reviews.comments: My favorite shade was Cockney, I could no longer find it. I took a chance and bought 2 new shades. I'm very pleased with both.

reviews.headline: I will be buying more of these MAC lipsticks
reviews.comments: This is a great long lasting lipstick. The color is perfect. Not to red. Not to brown.

reviews.headline: Staying power
reviews.comments: Pretty color matte lipstick.  Stays put

reviews.headline: Favoriteü§ç
reviews.comments: Love it!!!

reviews.headline: Red lipstick
reviews.comments: The staff was helpful and friendly. The lipstick was perfect if a little pricey.

reviews.headline: Nice every day color
reviews.comments: Feels a little on the dry side, have to keep reapplying, but I do like the color

reviews.headline: Amazing formula, I wish there were more shades
reviews.comments:
The texture and look of this lipstick are incredible. The soft blurring effect is so forgiving if you don't have the perfect lip base- I live in a dry climate and have had lipsticks leaving me looking awful after application because of how they pool. It was so shocking to find that this formula actually leaves my lips looking alright after- many lipsticks I've tried end up drying my lips throughout the day. 

Absolutely favorite formula, sultry move is my favore lipstick. If they offered some griege, or neutral gray beigey tones for the alternative and goth girls, I would buy 10 just to ensure I always had one. We've been looking for ages and if mac brought a powderkiss version, it would dominate.

reviews.headline: Color of 314 is perfect and as blush but too drying on lips
reviews.comments: Wish it was less drying on lips. I love the color and it works as blush too....

reviews.headline: Pretty- but HATE the smell
reviews.comments: Im not one to be sensitive to scents but this lipstick has such an overwhelmingly strong fragrance. Almost like vanilla and cough syrup. It gives me an instant headache and even nausea sometimes when i wear it. Unfortunate because its so pretty and comfortabke to wear :(

reviews.headline: Love the color Velvet Punch
reviews.comments: Love the color and the way it feels on my lips

reviews.headline: I will buy this lipstick again !!
reviews.comments: Love the color  -  Myth.

reviews.headline: I've purchased this lipstick 3X
reviews.comments: Gorgeous color and i love the matte. If i need to glam it up a bit I add a gloss. This matte lipstick stays put for many hours!

reviews.headline: Beautiful color.
reviews.comments: beautiful color but not enough pigment... wears off quickly.

reviews.headline: Really good
reviews.comments: Stunning color, and MAC is always solid on formula. I just much prefer the silky matte texture as opposed to the powder kiss.

media.headline: Label is right, shade seems wrong...
Loved mull it over shade for my olive skin tone.
Loved mull it over shade for my olive skin tone.
A Must Have for Brown Skin Women
Not the best, not the worst.
Where has this been all my life?

faceoff_positive.comments: I have a love/hate relationship with matte lipsticks. I despise shiny lips on me, but matte lipsticks are usually really drying. This is a great in-between formula that's SO comfortable to wear. It doesn't look like I've smeared my mouth with gloss, but it doesn't suck the life out of my lips, either. The Werk Werk Werk shade is gorgeous! I've looked and looked for a red that's less intense than my favorites (Russian Red and Ruby Woo) without being pink on me. (I'm medium-fair with blonde hair and light eyes, so it might look more pink than red on a darker complexion.) This one is my new holy grail soft red. It manages to be red without being !!RED!!, if that makes any sense. I love the way that I can apply it lighter for a sheer look or heavier for more color, and it's still red no matter what. The only downside I've found is that it can smear easily, but that's how it goes if you're wearing something that's not a super matte or long-wear lipstick. The color fades a bit throughout the day, but I don't mind reapplying. If you have fine lines around your mouth, you might want to use a lip liner. The first time I used it, it feathered within a couple of hours. I use a clear liner with Powder Kiss lipsticks because I usually go for a soft-focus application instead of a sharp lined look. I've never found a liner that doesn't also work its way into the lines along with my lipstick, but clear does the job with this lipstick formula. When I discovered the Powder Kiss formula, I bought several and let my mom and sister both pick one from my haul. They love them, too.
faceoff_positive.headline: My perfect red

faceoff_negative.comments:
I like the concept of it, it's more silicone based so it feels very lightweight. This formula doesn't have the waxy feel of a matte lipstick but doesn't feel as oily/waxy as a satin for example. The slip it has is much more light feeling. HOWEVER, the lipstick transfers pretty easily. It transfers as much a lustre or glaze. I do enjoy that sort of soft-focus look but if you have deeper lines it doesn't make much of a difference. Another thing I'm not fond of is the pigment. It seems more like a buildable coverage. My issue with buildable is that you'll end up with the creasing aspect of color pooling into the lines and emphasizing them. I don't like that the formula varies by shade. Some crease up more than others, some aren't as pigmented as others. I think MAC ought to formulate each color to be consistent. I do quite like "Devoted to Chili" though, looks great for the fall! 

In general I like the formula, though I feel this formula should have really utilized their nude shades, that soft focus look would look amazing with nude shades for everyday wear especially with this lightweight formula. I'd love to see Yash, Kinda Sexy, Cherish, Angel, Creme Cup, Peachstock and even faux in this formula.
faceoff_negative.headline: neutral about it.
